next_steps: Choose one of the three concrete experiments (e.g., 'Prompting patterns generalize or not?') that sounds most interesting and feasible.
Identify 3-4 specific tasks/datasets (e.g., a subset of GSM8K, SQuAD, or a small classification dataset) that fit the chosen experiment and are readily available.
Draft a preliminary hypothesis, outline the prompt variants or intervention, and define the metrics (e.g., accuracy, F1) for the chosen experiment, focusing on what can be done with limited compute.

next_steps: Read the CheckList paper (http://arxiv.org/abs/2005.04118) and Datasheets for Datasets (http://arxiv.org/abs/1803.09010) to understand the methods for behavioral testing and documentation.
